content.raw:
I have a setup where I use ignition transport to communicate between two nodes. The only communication that I use is services, in a manner that node1 is a client and node2 is a server for each service (sort of master-slave). The server is running gazebo simulation (gazebo 8), while the client is controlling the simulation through service calls. 

When I run this setup locally, it works without any issues. But when I run it in Docker, the program quite often crashes because the timeout is passed. The error message that I am getting is simply a wall of:


```
#!

Exception sending a message
Exception sending a message
Exception sending a message
Exception sending a message
Exception sending a message
Exception sending a message
Exception sending a message
...
```

Any idea why this could be the case? I am also running multiple simulations at the same time, i.e. multiple Docker containers with the same simulation (on the same machine), which might be the cause of some network issues?
